thread.title: Chelsea transfer news: Moussa Dembele talked up by Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea transfer news: Moussa Dembele talked up by Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea transfer news: Moussa Dembele talked up by Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 28 Feb 2017 11:25 am Moussa Dembele has been banging in the goals recently, with nine in his last four outings (Getty) 
Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink believes Chelsea transfer target Moussa Dembele has the potential to be as lethal as the Premier League’s leading strikers Romelu Lukaku and Harry Kane. 
The Blues have been persistently linked with a move for the Celtic striker, with reports suggesting they are ready to make a £40million raid for the young striker. 
Hasselbaink, who scored 88 goals for Chelsea over four seasons at Stamford Bridge, believes Dembele would be a great acquisition for his former club. 
‘He will have to move [to be considered a world class player]. 
‘I think he is a bracket below [Romelu] Lukaku and Harry Kane at the moment, but he has the potential. 
‘I know him very well from when he was at Fulham.’ Chelsea manager Antonio Conte reportedly sees Dembele as a good back-up for Diego Costa (Getty) Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink during his time at Chelsea (Getty) 
Chelsea have been criticised in some quarters for failing to move for Dembele when his contract expired at Fulham last summer. Celtic pounced on the France Under-21 international and have been well rewarded with Dembele finding the net 29 times in 42 appearances. Hasselbaink believes that had the 20-year-old joined the Blues last summer he may not have developed as well as he has. 
‘I think his agents have done a shrewd job to send him to Celtic to let him play week in week out. 
‘To be in a big arena, to have the pressure to win every match. But also for him to get games and to score and to feel that net over and over again – to get in that habit. Chelsea fixtures 
West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Manchester Utd – FA Cup (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr Manchester United (A) – Sat 15 Apr
